TopicTitle: Making an object connect to radial decouplers but not SRF.

Articles.Content: Is it possible to do this? I'm making a rocket / bomb thing and for it to work / not explode on launch it needs to be on a radial decoupler.
and so the warmonger was born on Kearth

and so the warmonger was born on Kearth

;D
I don't think it's possible to make it so it can attach to a radial coupler but not to the surface of other parts. Try playing with the Attachrules?

Not sure if this would work but you could try to make a 'special' radial coupler with a top node on the side and put a bottom node at the side of your bomb model. Only allow stacking in the bomb config so IF someone tries to use the bomb without the coupler he would have to put it sideways on the top of his rocket and this would not be very usefull.

Just a thought..

Belated, but a thought--why not make a custom radial coupler that has purple top and bottom nodes off to the side, and attach the fore and aft parts of the bomb to that with purple nodes? On many combat aircraft, after all, the weapon pylon is released along with the bomb... (just a thought from someone with zero experience making addons since the days of MSFS 4.0 and the Aircraft and Scenery Designer.)
